Package com.foreach.across.modules.entity.bind

Class SingleEntityPropertyBinder

java.lang.Object
com.foreach.across.modules.entity.bind.SingleEntityPropertyBinder
All Implemented Interfaces:
EntityPropertyBinder
public final class SingleEntityPropertyBinder extends Object
Represents a single value property, always attached to a EntityPropertiesBinder. The original property value will be loaded as soon as any value-related action is attempted.
Since:
3.2.0
Author:
Arne Vandamme

  • Method Details

    • getInitializedValue

      public Object getInitializedValue()
      Description copied from interface: EntityPropertyBinder
      Get the current value or initialize a new value if it has not been set. Use this method if you want to create intermediate bean paths because you want to update underlying properties of the entity.

      Using getInitializedValue() will also delegate any existing value to EntityPropertyController.createDto(EntityPropertyBindingContext, Object) for creating a DTO object that can be safely updated without directly applying the changes to the underlying entity it possibly represents.

      Specified by:
      getInitializedValue in interface EntityPropertyBinder
      Returns:
      the value and initialize a new value if necessary
      See Also:
      • EntityPropertyBinder.createNewValue()
      • EntityPropertyController.createDto(EntityPropertyBindingContext, Object)

    • isModified

      public boolean isModified()
      Description copied from interface: EntityPropertyBinder
      Check if the property that this binder represents has been modified.
      Returns:
      true if the property has been modified, a deleted property is usually also considered modified

    • resolvePropertyBinder

      public EntityPropertyBinder resolvePropertyBinder(@NonNull @NonNull EntityPropertyDescriptor descriptor)
      Resolve the EntityPropertyBinder for the property descriptor. If the descriptor represents a nested property, intermediate binders might get initialized in order to correctly resolve the target property.

      This will initialize the child properties binder as if calling getProperties().
      Parameters:
      descriptor - to resolve
      Returns:
      binder for the property

    • setBound

      public final void setBound(boolean bound)
      Description copied from interface: EntityPropertyBinder
      Set the value of this property as bound using a data binder. This usually signals that a property was present in a web form. Usually setting this to true means that the property value should be deleted if no actual value has been set.
      Specified by:
      setBound in interface EntityPropertyBinder

    • createNewValue

      public Object createNewValue()
      Description copied from interface: EntityPropertyBinder
      Initialize a new value for this property. Will not actually update the property value itself but will attempt to return a new instance that can be set as the value.
      Specified by:

      Returns:
      new value, can be null

    • applyValue

      public boolean applyValue()
      Description copied from interface: EntityPropertyBinder
      Apply the current property value to the owning entity by calling EntityPropertyController.applyValue(EntityPropertyBindingContext, EntityPropertyValue). If the property is considered deleted, the value of EntityPropertyValue.isDeleted() will be true.
      Specified by:
      applyValue in interface EntityPropertyBinder
      Returns:
      true if value has been applied

    • setDeleted

      public void setDeleted(boolean deleted)
      Description copied from interface: EntityPropertyBinder

      Specified by:
      setDeleted in interface EntityPropertyBinder
      Parameters:
      deleted - true if property should be considered deleted

      public String getItemKey()
